intro: Dryandra favosa, commonly known as the yellow dryandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, urn-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with narrow, leathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
